page.title: 19HOW NORTH YATE HAS CHANGED.
page.content: A few years ago,the whole area consisted of farms and fields,with houses just along North Road,and dotted here and there in the country lanes.North Road itself used to be referred to as"The Golden Mile"because of all the land that people owned. Shops have come and gone.The general grocery shop,Royalls,used to be a Post Office.The Post Office is now next door to the school.A fish and chip shop that was by the crossroads has long since closed down.In the south-eastern part of the area,the new housing estates are growing fast.A new road has been built to take traffic from the centre of Yate out onto the main Bristol road.People who have lived here for a long time are concerned that the factories,roads and housing will spoil the area.
